availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Brock (Union County, Tennessee, farmer and private (U.S.A.). )

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer, sheriff, and soldier. Tennessee native. Married Sarah Day Brock in Claiborne County, Tennessee, in December 1841. Father of Samuel R. Brock, Martha A. Brock, Winfield S. Brock, and Louisa Brock. Farmer in Claiborne County in 1850. Married to Phebe Brock. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Sheriff in Union County in 1860. Served in 7th Tennessee Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from August 12, 1864 to November 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Claiborne County, p. 305B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District 3, p. 437.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1778-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Claiborne County Marriages, p. 33.

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Tennessee, of the Military Forces of the State, from 1861 to 1866, (Nashville: S. C. Mercer, 1866), 284
KYR-0001-021-0031.
